result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Thomas, Herman J., Jr.
defendant.address: c/o Racine County Jail 717 Wisconsin Avenue, Racine, WI 53403

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Herman J. Thomas Jr. in court.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp in court for Herman J. Thomas Jr.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Offer received. Atty Kopp still obtaining discovery.  DE has pending cases in Racine Co.  PLEAH scheduled. Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 588019,
Payable Number: 350710,
Receipt Number: 22R 029176,
Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Due to ongoing JT, 8/31 hearing rescheduled to 10/14 845am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Kopp.  Clerk HM.  DE's sub of atty.  Atty Shamali appears and is relieved as atty for DE.  Atty Kopp requests adjmt. Granted.  PTC 8/31 9am.

09:20 AM Defendant, Herman J. Thomas, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  22CF487/22CF488/22CM309. Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading. ST called witness KPD Officer Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Shamali. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Branch 1 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney Shamali. Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant, Herman J. Thomas, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  State requests brief adjournment for more investigation.  DE objects.  Court grants request for adjournment and tolls time for cause.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
